title: Oscar Pistorius sentenced to five years in prison â live | World news | The Guardian
summary: pistorius leaves the court for prison .
five years in jail for culpable homicide .

documents.title: end-of-day summary
text: oscar pistorius is behind bars , reportedly at kgosi mampuru ii prison in pretoria , beginning a five-year jail sentence for the culpable homicide of reeva steenkamp .
judge thokozile masipa has given pistorius a five-year prison sentence , telling him : i am of the view that a non-custodial sentence would send a wrong message to the community .
on the other hand , a long sentence would not be appropriate either , as it would lack the element of mercy .
she also handed down a three-year sentence for negligently discharging a firearm in a crowded restaurant , wholly suspended and to be served concurrently .
oscar pistorius is lead by an officer into a holding cell after being sentenced .
hadebe/afp/getty images pistorius must also surrender all his guns and firearms licences .
the judge said house arrest and community service proposed by two defence witnesses in mitigation would not be appropriate for pistorius , who deliberately fired four shots into the door .
but the judge acknowledged that there would be many who disagreed with her ruling : society can not always get what they want .
courts do not exist for a popularity contest but only to dispense justice ¦ the general public may not even know the difference between punishment and vengeance .
masipa described reeva steenkamp as : young , vivacious and full of life ¦ a promising young woman who cared deeply for family , who was full of hope for the future , and lived life to the full .
the loss of life can not be reversed .
nothing i do or say today can reverse what happened to the deceased and to her family .
hopefully this sentence shall provide some sort of closure to the family ¦ so they can move on with their lives .
steenkamp 's parents said they were satisfied with the sentence .
but june steenkamp , her mother , said there would not be closure , unless you can magic her back .
her father barry said : i 'm pleased that it 's over .
parents of the late reeva steenkamp , june , front , and barry back , leave court in pretoria , south africa , after oscar pistorius was handed down a five-year sentence .

de ras/ap there are disputed claims about how long the athlete will serve in prison , with the defence team indicating it expects him to be considered for house arrest after 10 months , and the national prosecuting authority insisting he must serve a minimum of one-third in jail : 20 months .

the defence is not expected to appeal the judgment , although prosecutors have stated there is an appetite for an appeal and they are looking at the legal basis for challenging the conviction and/or sentence .
pistorius is reportedly currently in kgosi mampuru ii prison , formerly pretoria central , where it is anticipated he will be housed in the hospital wing .
the pistorius family has said it accepts the judgment .
the athlete 's uncle , arnold pistorius , said : i hope oscar will start his own healing process as we walk down the path of restoration .
as a family we are ready to support and guide oscar as he serves his sentence .
the international paralympic committee has said pistorius will be banned from athletics competitions until 2019 .
david smith 's report from pretoria today is here and a summary of all 49 days of this trial is here .
this live blog will wrap up now .
thank you for reading .

documents.title: will there be an appeal ?
text: the national prosecuting authority has indicated it has an appetite to appeal .
it had wanted a conviction for premeditated murder and could appeal against the judge 's decision to clear pistorius of that charge .

some south african lawyers have already questioned whether the judge erred in clearing him of a lesser charge of non-premeditated murder ( dolus eventualis , that he must have known he was likely to kill a person by firing through the door ) .
if the state decided to challenge the conviction and/or sentence , prosecutor gerrie nel would have to make an application for appeal within 14 days to judge masipa .
the defence , on the other hand , appears unlikely to appeal .

the statement by arnold pistorius , the athlete 's uncle , on behalf of the family said they accepted the judgment and asked others to do the same a hint , perhaps , that they will not appeal and wish to dissuade calls for the state to pursue one .
the summary of the oscar pistorius trial the full story , day by day has been updated to include today , day 49 , and the sentence .
you can read it here .

we now have some better images of pistorius being escorted by police officers to the armoured vehicle transporting him from the high court to prison earlier today : oscar pistorius , rear right , is led to a waiting police vehicle to be taken to prison .
de ras/ap oscar pistorius on his way to prison .
media members of the south african police service with oscar pistorius in the back of an armoured police vehicle .
sutherland/epa
guardian columnist simon jenkins argues in this comment piece that sending pistorius to jail was the wrong decision , and will deter no one .
pistorius has reportedly arrived at kgosi mampuru ii prison : ewn reporter ( @ ewnreporter ) # oscarpistrious is now at the kgosi mampuru correctional facility .
he was taken inside through another entrance .
gw

my colleague owen gibson , the guardian 's chief sports correspondent , confirms that pistorius will be banned from athletics competitions until 2019 : an international paralympic committee spokesman confirmed that pistorius , the first athlete to compete in both the olym and paralym in london in 2012 , would be banned from the rio games even if he had been released on licence by that point .
the ipc said that under its rules he would be banned from competition for the full five years unless he appealed and his sentence was formally reduced .
his family have said there will not be any appeal .
the rules state that if someone is given a five-year sentence by a court , they must serve that sentence before returning to competition , ' an ipc spokesman told the guardian .
the 27-year-old south african will be 33 by the time of the tokyo olym and paralym in 2020 but it is debatable whether he will be in any shape to compete by then .
there will also be a question mark over whether he will be able to travel freely to some countries having been convicted of culpable homicide .

the anc women 's league , which has been supporting reeva steenkamp 's mother , june , throughout the trial , has been tweeting out this statement : # ancwl together with the nation is watching , with grave concern , the sentencing of oscar pistorius in the north gauteng high court today .

we have sought a legal opinion on the proceedings thus far , especially on the interpretation of the pistorius judgment ¦ # ancwl remains dissatisfied with the verdict delivered by judge masipa finding mr pistorius guilty of culpable homicide instead of murder .
our conviction on this matter arises on the basis that we believe regardless of whom mr pistorius believed was behind the bathroom door ¦ mr pistorius shot to kill and therefore a murder did occur .
# ancwl will be making submissions to the state on our view that an appeal in this case is in the interest of the judicial system .
# ancwl has consistently campaigned for harsh sentences in all cases of violence against women and children .
as an organisation we are highly concerned with the high level of femicide in our country .
statistics indicate that a woman is killed in every eight hours in south africa .
this situation is abnormal and should be unacceptable to every citizen .
we would want to see this verdict being expunged as a precedent setting case in our statutes .
pistorius , who has left the court in a prison van , is expected to arrive at kgosi mampuru ii prison , formerly pretoria central , fairly soon .
as pretoria central , the jail was notorious for holding political prisoners and was the official site for capital punishment carried out in south africa during the apartheid era .
a prison cell inside the pretoria central prison during a surprise raid by prison officials checking for drugs and other contraband .
ndingane / barcroft media the giant facility on the outskirts of the capital crams 17 bunk beds into communal cells measuring around 100ft by 30ft .
ndingane / barcroft media pistorius , of course , is expected to be housed in the hospital wing , rather than a regular cell .
in the sentencing hearing , zac modise , acting national head of correctional services , told the court he was absolutely sure this would happen .

carl pistorius , oscar 's brother , was in court this morning and has been tweeting since the sentence was handed down : carl pistorius ( @ carlpistorius ) may god gives you grace so that your salvation might be built up and not broken - regardless of the circumstance .
# hiswordwillnotreturnvoid along with this of carl and oscar pistorius as children : carl pistorius ( @ carlpistorius ) together in christ we are strong , in christ there can never be defeat .

# livewitheternityinmind and on the disputed issue of how long oscar pistorius will serve in prison : carl pistorius ( @ carlpistorius ) position : @ twitterid was sentenced under section 276 1 i ) of criminal procedures act - he must serve 1/6th of his sentence in custody .

here is david smith 's report from court in pretoria : oscar pistorius will spend his first day behind bars on tuesday after a judge jailed him for five years for the killing of his girlfriend , reeva steenkamp .

looking distressed , the paralympian clasped the hands of family members as a police officer led him from the dock down 23 steps paint peeling off the handrail to gloomy holding cells below the high court in pretoria , the capital of south africa .
the national prosecuting authority said pistorius , 27 , would be taken to prison immediately and eligible to be considered for parole after serving a third of his sentence .
his uncle , arnold pistorius , indicated he would not appeal .
the athlete stood staring straight ahead as judge thokozile masipa announced his sentence .
there was a muted reaction from the families on the front bench of the public gallery .
masipa rejected many of the defence arguments and described the evidence of defence witness and social worker annette vergeer as slapdash and disappointing ' .
she said she had no reason to believe that south africa 's prisons would not be able to cater for the needs of a disabled person like pistorius .
it would be a sad day for this country if an impression was created that there is one law for the poor and disadvantaged and another for the rich and famous , ' she noted .
masipa said a judge must strive for a sentence neither too light nor too severe ' , ruling that a non-custodial sentence will send a wrong message to the community ' .

referring to the steenkamp family , the judge said : nothing i do or say today can reverse what happened to the deceased or her family on 14 february 2013 ' but said that hopefully her judgment would provide some form of closure .
steenkamp 's father , barry , said afterwards : i 'm pleased that it 's over .
the steenkamps ' lawyer , dup de bruyn , told afp that the sentence would probably be served as two years in prison and three years under house arrest .
in effect , he gets three years ' correctional supervision and two years ' direct imprisonment . '
de bruyn said steenkamp 's parents were satisfied with the decision .
they feel it 's right , ' he added .
pistorius was also given three years suspended for five years for a firearms offence .
that pistorius family statement suggests the defence will not be appealing against the five-year sentence or conviction for culpable homicide that preceded it .

documents.title: pistorius family statement
text: oscar pistorius 's uncle , arnold pistorius , is addressing reporters outside the court .
today a new season starts for us as a family ¦ not just the pistorius family alone , but the steenkamp family .
it has been a harrowing 20 months .
we are all emotionally drained and exhausted .
the case that was set down for three weeks originally has been dragged out for seven months in fact , for 20 months [ since the bail hearing ] .

in the process , [ the state ] decided to inflict as much collateral damage as they could , by keeping the cloud of premeditated murder as long as possible ¦ the truth became totally irrelevant to the state 's case to make premeditated murder stick .
we accept the judgment .
oscar will embrace this opportunity to pay back to society .
i appeal to all of you as the media to accept the ruling of the court .
after 20 months of relentless public trial , i would ask you ¦ to let us move forward ¦ and give us some degree of dignity and privacy as we do so .
i want to say something as an uncle .
i hope oscar will start his own healing process as we walk down the path of restoration .
as a family we are ready to support and guide oscar as he serves his sentence .
please understand that i do n't want to take any questions .

confirmation of that report that pistorius has been banned from competing at rio in 2016 from the guardian 's chief sports correspondent owen gibson : owen gibson ( @ owen g ) the ipc confirms that pistorius wo n't be allowed to return to competition for five years .

documents.title: pistorius leaves the court for prison
text: earlier than expected , pistorius has left the court , entering a prison van in the midst of a melee of police officers , media and onlookers , before being driven away , pursued by photographers .
i 've taken these slightly shaky screengrabs from sky news .
pistorius enters the police van .
/sky news the prison van carrying pistorius leaves the high court .
/sky news

documents.title: pistorius 'banned from 2016 rio paralym
text: nbc reports that the international paralympic committee has said it would not allow pistorius to compete in brazil in september 2016 .

documents.title: summary
text: a recap as pistorius waits in the holding cell at the high court in pretoria to be taken to begin his prison sentence : judge thokozile masipa has given pistorius a five-year prison sentence for the culpable homicide of reeva steenkamp .
she also handed down a three-year sentence for negligently discharging a firearm in a crowded restaurant , wholly suspended and to be served concurrently .

there are disputed claims about how long the athlete will serve in prison , with the defence team indicating it expects him to be considered for house arrest after 10 months , and the national prosecuting authority insisting he must serve a minimum of one-third in jail : 20 months .
pistorius is expected to be moved this afternoon to kgosi mampuru ii prison , formerly pretoria central , where it is anticipated he will be housed in the hospital wing .
the pistorius family is due to give a press conference shortly ; i 'll have live coverage here .
here 's an image of oscar pistorius as he stood to hear the judge hand down a five-year sentence for culpable homicide .
his sister aimee pistorius is behind him with her head in her hand .
pistorius hears his sentence .
/sky news
friends of reeva steenkamp are speaking outside the court .
sisters kim and gina myers have attended court throughout the trial ; reeva steenkamp was due to stay at their house the night after she was killed .
kim myers told reporters : at the moment we 're all just very overwhelmed , i do n't think we 've had the opportunity to take it in it .
gina myers added : nothing is going to bring her back .
nothing will ever feel just ¦ but everybody has done their best .
i want people to always remember what she stood for ¦ to remember reeva .
she was an extraordinary human being .
that 's what 's important .
i really do n't think that any of us will heal any time soon ¦ but it 's one step closer .
kim myers , left , during the murder trial .
skuy/ap
pistorius is expected to be taken to kgosi mampuru ii prison , formerly pretoria central .
it 's believed he will stay in the holding cell below the court until around 4pm south africa time ( 3pm bst ) before being moved by police convoy , along with other prisoners , to the jail .
a pistorius family spokesman said his sister , aimee pistorius , has sent his washbag and phone down to him in the holding cell .
in evidence last week , zach modise , acting national head of correctional services , said pistorius should be housed in a hospital wing , rather than the general section of the prison .
he will have a health assessment within six hours of admission to the prison .
this includes assessment of social , psychological and spiritual needs , and caters for different vulnerabilities , modise told the court .
that assessment determines where the prisoner is placed .
kgosi mampuru ii prison in pretoria , where pistorius is expected to serve his sentence .
/sky news
speaking on sky news , nathi mncube of the national prosecuting authority , says the state team is busy studying the case law to see if it can appeal .
this is not what we were hoping to achieve by the end of this trial ¦ but it is not entirely up to us .
we accept that at some point somebody has to make a decision and we respect the decision the judge has made .
an appetite to appeal is not enough , he says : they must meet legal requirements for an appeal he says the prosecutors find solace in the custodial sentence handed down .
people might not be happy with the outcome but at the end of the day that 's what justice is all about .
the guardian video team has put together this clip of pistorius , as he was sentenced to five years in prison for the manslaughter of reeva steenkamp .
the judge also gave pistorius a three-year suspended sentence for a firearms charge .
judge thokozile masipa asks pistorius to stand before she delivers her ruling to a packed court in pretoria .
my colleague david smith , in pretoria , has spoken to reeva steenkamp 's father , barry , who told him : i 'm pleased that it 's over .
as the court room empties , some defining images from the close of the trial : aislinn laing ( @ simmoa ) this is all that remains in the oscar pistorius dock .
white roses and a sick bucket ( empty ) .
# oscarpistorius aislinn laing ( @ simmoa ) pistorius disappeared to the cells down these stairs - 23 in total with a door at the bottom .
# oscarpistorius
we are hearing that the pistorius family will give a press conference at midday south african time ( 11am bst ) ; we will have live coverage on this blog .

a striking of pistorius being taken down to the holding cell below the court , clutching the hands of his uncle and aunt , arnold and lois pistorius , who have supported him throughout the trial : stephanie findlay ( @ sjfindlay ) # pistorius goes down the stairs to prison
how much of the five-year sentence pistorius will serve in prison is already a matter of much dispute .
the defence says it expects him to need to serve one-sixth of the sentence 10 months before being considered for release to house arrest .
the national prosecuting authority says one-third of the sentence 20 months is the minimum requirement .
stephanie findlay ( @ sjfindlay ) already a discrepancy , steenkamp lawyer says 5 year sentence means # pistorius will spend 2 years in jail , defence says much less time
as he left the court , barry steenkamp , father of reeva , told reporters he was very satisfied with the sentence .
asked if it was sufficient , he appeared to reply : yes .

nathi mncube , a spokesperson for the national prosecuting authority , has cast doubt on the defence interpretation that pistorius could serve as little as 10 months before being considered for house arrest .
mncube says the npa believes he would have to serve a third of the jail time around 20 months but it 's not for the npa to decide .
he adds that the npa has an appetite to appeal , but has not made a decision to do so .
both sides have 14 days in which to lodge an appeal should they choose to .
pistorius 's legal team is leaving the court room .
their understanding is that he will serve 10 months in jail and then move to house arrest .
they say they will not comment on the appropriateness of the sentence .
june steenkamp has not made a formal statement , but has responded to questions from reporters in court .
she said the five-year sentence brought a sort of closure , but there would be no closure without reeva unless you can magic her back .
the steenkamps ' lawyer said they wanted justice to be done and they are satisfied it has been done .
june steenkamp , mother of reeva steenkamp , watches as judge thokozile masipa reads her sentence .
hadebe/afp/getty images

members of the anc women 's league , who have been supporting june steenkamp , reeva 's mother , throughout the trial , are speaking outside the court : i 'm not going to speak for the family ¦ but we know how they feel .
you can see that they are saddened .
you can see that yourselves .
south african legal experts say pistorius must serve at least one-sixth of his sentence before being considered for house arrest .
on a five-year sentence , that would be around 10 months .
i will try to confirm this .
reporters in court in pretoria say that arnold pistorius , uncle of the jailed athlete , has indicated there will be no appeal the family expected him to go to jail .
david smith ( @ smithinafrica ) asked uncle arnold # pistorius if there would be an appeal .
he shook his head and said , `` no '' .
june steenkamp , mother of reeva , has told reporters in court : it 's right .
pistorius is likely to serve his custodial sentence at kgosi mampuru ii prison in pretoria .
first he will be fingerprinted in the holding cell below the court before being transferred .
alex crawford ( @ alexcrawfordsky ) # pistoriustrial june steenkamp smiles briefly .
perhaps some closure finally
barry steenkamp ( 2nd right ) , the father of reeva steenkamp , listens to judge masipa 's sentence .
verwey/afp/getty images

documents.title: pistorius taken to holding cell
text: pistorius is sitting still and silent in the dock .
as the judge leaves , he is led down to the holding cell below the court .
masipa thanks counsel for their work , as well as the court officials and the gallery .
it was not an easy matter but in general i was very pleased with the conduct of everyone involved .
and with that she adjourns the court hearing .
barry roux , for the defence , says pistorius does not want to possess guns any more ; he will hand them , and his certificates , over to the state .
nel : i think the court has done what the court should do .
there has been no visible reaction from pistorius , his family members , or the steenkamp family and supporters to the sentence .
prosecutor gerrie nel is telling the judge that pistorius should not be allowed to have firearms .
on the firearms charge , pistorius gets three years in jail , wholly suspended for five years .

documents.title: five years in jail for culpable homicide
text: count 1 : culpable homicide .
five years in prison .

documents.title: sentence is coming
text: pistorius is asked to stand .
masipa says she is mindful that mercy is nothing to do with weakness or sympathy for the criminal , but is about justice .
masipa : i am of the view that a non-custodial sentence would send a wrong message to the community .
on the other hand , a long sentence would not be appropriate either , as it would lack the element of mercy .

documents.title: 'suspended sentence not appropriate '
text: masipa : the present case is so serious that a suspended sentence would not be appropriate in my view .
masipa now moves on to discuss another case of a man who shot his wife after mistaking her for an intruder .
he received an eight-year prison sentence , suspended .
but again , she disagrees on the degree of similarity between that case and the present one .

documents.title: 'house arrest not appropriate for pistorius '
text: masipa says that considering the degree of negligence , a house arrest sentence would not be appropriate .
david smith ( @ smithinafrica ) masipa : the sentence suggested by maringa and vergeer `` would not be appropriate '' in this matter .
# pistorius
the careful demolition of comparisons to the vorster case suggests masipa is not going to impose a suspended sentence .
but as ever , it is not wise to try to second-guess this judge .
vorster case was dissimilar to pistorius 's case , though , the judge goes on .
vorster did not have a disability .
vorster did not know there was a person behind the door when he fired pistorius did .
only one shot was fired by vorster , and was not aimed at the door .
pistorius deliberately fired four shots into the door .
vorster aimed to frighten away the supposed intruder ; pistorius 's intention was to shoot the apparent intruder .
pistorius could have escaped the threat , she adds .
pistorius was trained in the use of firearms a high degree of responsibility should be expected of such a person .
a court should be merciful in sentencing , she reads from the vorster ruling , with an appreciation of human frailties .
in the vorster case , the perpetrator was given community service and a suspended jail term .
mandy wiener ( @ mandywiener ) # oscartrial masipa does pay special attention to voster case - employer shot domestic worker 's grandchild thinking it was an intruder .
but the court found no gross negligence in that case , she adds .
gia nicolaides ( @ gianicolaides ) # oscarpistorius masipa : never seen an accused so remorseful , years after incident vorster still suffering from pts .
oscar pistorius listens to proceedings .
his brother , carl , is in the background .
hadebe/ap
the defence cited some other cases of culpable homicide in which perpetrators were not jailed .
masipa says none of these are relevant .
but she mentions a couple of other cases that she thinks have some bearing on this one .
masipa is moving to her conclusion .
the basic criterion is the degree of culpability , or blameworthiness , of the accused , she says .
how far did his actions deviate from the norms of reasonable behaviour ?

the interests of society must also take into account the effects on the steenkamp family , says masipa , describing the victim as : young , vivacious and full of life ¦ a promising young woman who cared deeply for family , who was full of hope for the future , and lived life to the full .
the loss of life can not be reversed .
nothing i do or say today can reverse what happened to the deceased and to her family .
hopefully this sentence shall provide some sort of closure to the family ¦ so they can move on with their lives .
the element of retribution is by no means absent from the modern approach , masipa cautions .
it has to have some recognition in the sentence imposed .
if sentences for serious crimes are too lenient , she says , the administration of justice may fall into disrepute and people persuaded to take the law into their own hands .

documents.title: judge : 'there is a difference between punishment and vengeance '
text: masipa turns to the interests of society society can not always get what they want .
courts do not exist for a popularity contest but only to dispense justice .
the general public may not even know the difference between punishment and vengeance .
we have moved on from an eye for an eye , she adds .
alex crawford ( @ alexcrawfordsky ) # pistoriustrial judge agrees with defence claim that negative media reports can affect a person 's reputation and outlook
masipa says pistorius was found guilty of two very serious offences , and says the state correct to say he was guilty of gross negligence bordering on dolus eventualis ( murder ) .
this , along with his experience and training in firearms , are very aggravating , she says .
in mitigation , she accepts pistorius 's apology to the parents of reeva steenkamp , as well as his conduct after the incident he wanted the deceased to live .
she says she can also take his disability and vulnerability into account .
june steenkamp and barry steenkamp , the parents of reeva steenkamp , arriving this morning .
haffejee/epa

turning to pistorius 's career , masipa says she can not ignore his contribution to society , including his charity work , but also can not pretend such charitable efforts did not also enhance his career .
there can not be a different rule for the rich and famous , masipa says .
pregnant women go to jail and they are also vulnerable .
she says she felt unease at all the evidence the over-emphasis , she says about his vulnerability .
he has excellent coping skills , she points out .
i have no reason to believe the accused would present the department of correctional services with an insurmountable problem .
masipa appears to be dismissing the defence 's arguments about the unsuitability of prison for pistorius .
there is the issue of the medical attention pistorius would need , and whether prison could meet that , the judge says .
david smith ( @ smithinafrica ) masipa : `` mr modise showed this court there is a medical team whose job it is to attend to inmates in need of medical attention . ''
# pistorius
prisoners have legal redress , masipa goes on : there is no reason why ¦ he would be treated differently [ in prison ] .
it would be wrong for the court to usurp the function of the correctional services department once sentence has been imposed , masipa says .
she is not going to be drawn into the debate stirred by the defence about the condition of south african jails , it seems .
masipa seems to have been convinced by the assurances of modise that the prison system would be able to cope with pistorius 's disabilities .
he would not be the first prisoner with his condition to be jailed , she says .
there would be no problems in catering for his needs , the witness told her masipa adds : none of this was controverted .
the defence said that his disabilities meant a period of correctional supervision was better than a jail term .
but masipa says she was not impressed by the evidence of vergeer .
her information was outdated , slapdash and disappointing , the judge said , and had a negative impact on her credibility .
i found her evidence perfunctory and unhelpful ¦ disturbing from someone with 28 years of experience .
on the other hand , she says , modise was a good witness who impressed her .
he said prisons were not perfect , but progressive and professional : i have no hesitation in accepting his evidence as true and reliable .
masipa is reading a lengthy extract from earlier evidence about the pain and limitations of pistorius 's disability .
andrew harding ( @ bbcandrewh ) plenty of details now from judge about # oscarpistorius disability how much will she read into that ?
on to the personal circumstances of the accused : he is 27 , a double-amputee , single , with no dependents , he lives with his uncle .
he has no properties , having sold them during the trial .
he has no previous convictions .
she talks about the amputation of his lower legs at the age of 11 months , recapping evidence from the main trial about the challenges of his disability , physical and emotional .

masipa runs through the evidence of zach modise , acting national head of correctional services , who told the court the prison system would be able to cope with pistorius 's disabilities , though he might need to be on a hospital wing .
david smith ( @ smithinafrica ) masipa : martin said steenkamp 's father took a turn for the worse after her death and he suffered a stroke .
# pistorius
oscar pistorius arrives in court this morning .
verwey/pool/epa
and on to the final defence witness : annette vergeer , who also recommended community service .
the judge now moves on to the state evidence in aggravation of sentence .
she runs through the evidence of kim martin , steenkamp 's cousin , about the life of the victim and what her loss has meant to the family .
she was a happy person , good in front of the camera and loved her family .
masipa moves on to defence evidence from pistorius 's manager peet van zyl that the athlete 's career was over , and about his previous work for charity .
emma sadleir ( @ emmasadleir ) i 'm outside court .
the crowds have started singing as judge masipa starts handing down her sentence inside # oscarpistorius
the defence witnesses argued that pistorius would be able to address his behaviour through correctional supervision that is , outside prison .
masipa now summarises the evidence of social worker joel maringa , who told the court pistorius should carry out 16 hours a month of community service , alongside three years of house arrest .
the judge turns to the arguments made in mitigation and aggravation .
( you can read a summary of those here . )
she turns to the evidence of pistorius 's personal psychologist , dr lore hartzenberg .
hartzenberg wanted the court to consider that pistorius had lost his relationship , career and money , masipa says .
on many occasions the [ therapy ] sessions had to be rescheduled because the accused was too emotional drained .
the process of sentencing is unscientific , she says reasonable people could arrive at different conclusions .
it is not a perfect exercise .
there may be more than one appropriate sentence in a case .
masipa says the decision on sentence is hers alone .
she has taken into account the circumstances of the accused as well as the interests of society .
retribution , deterrence , reformation and rehabilitation must also be considered , she says .

documents.title: court is in session
text: judge masipa tells pistorius he can remain seated for now .
she begins to read her judgment on sentence , first outlining the two charges on which he was found guilty .
south africa 's president , jacob zuma , has told the guardian that pistorius 's disability is not an issue if he were to be sent to jail .

after the defence team argued that the country 's overcrowded prison system would be incapable of guaranteeing pistorius 's safety , or the medical and psychological help he needs , zuma said : i 'm not sure why that comes into the they were taking that too far , in my view .
there are people who are [ physically ] challenged in prisons ; it 's not an issue here .
that brings an unfortunate thing , an added thing , because a man has money .
i thought that was an unfortunate debate .
you do n't need it , because there are people who are disabled who are in prison .
why it is raised as if he was the first one to be convicted ?
i thought they were pushing it too far .
others have echoed concerns about the state of south africa 's prisons more generally .

ruth hopkins , an investigative journalist at the wits justice project , has visited the hospital section of pretoria 's kgosi mampuru ii prison , where pistorius would probably serve any custodial sentence : the general problem with the department of correctional services is that the legal framework is very robust and impressive but in practice it 's a whole different ballgame .
however , i do n't think oscar pistorius will run into a lot of problems because he has a name and connections and network and most importantly money .
most of the cases we investigate are poor people who lack money or the ability to navigate the criminal justice system .

according to a report in south africa 's times live , prisoners in kgosi mampuru have vowed to protect pistorius should he end up there , with one current inmate reportedly saying : pistorius will have people who clean and wash for him , do things for him .
the gangs will obviously try to protect him , make promises and offers , especially the senior members .
any cellphone he wants is his .
a smart- phone , blackberry ¦ he need not worry about his family , he can skype with them any time .
people in here are getting ready for him , organising things he might want or need .
people know mr pistorius is a no-go , off limits to any form of harm .
those protecting him will not hesitate to do what they must to ensure his protection , but this comes at a cost .
pistorius 's estranged father , henke pistorius , is in court , my colleague david smith reports : david smith ( @ smithinafrica ) at high court in pretoria .
asked oscar # pistorius 's father henke if the trial has brought them closer .
`` yes , it 's a plus .
a huge plus . ''
reporters in the court say there is not yet any sign of the athlete 's brother , carl , though his sister aimee has just arrived .

along with sentence for the culpable homicide of steenkamp , pistorius is expected to hear his punishment today for the other charge on which he was found guilty , that of negligently discharging a firearm in public .
the court heard that he discharged a firearm at a restaurant in january 2013 , after pistorius said his friend darren fresco passed him the loaded gun .
defence counsel barry roux said pistorius had made a mistake .
ahead of sentencing , family members of both oscar pistorius and reeva steenkamp have been talking to the media about what they hope to hear from judge thokozile masipa today .
steenkamp 's sister , simone cowburn , has told the uk 's daily mail that pistorius ought to be facing a jail sentence of 10 to 20 years : oscar deserves prison .
how can he just stay in the luxury of his house after taking somebody 's life ?
community service and house arrest are ridiculous .
these should be for people who are stealing or other minor offences .
not shooting somebody .
reeva deserves justice .
this case will set a precedent all around the world .
we do not want other men to get off just because oscar pistorius has .
it is still homicide .
reeva steenkamp , in june 2012 .
bernard/epa aimee pistorius and carl pistorius , the athlete 's siblings , have given a number of interviews in which they express their support for their brother , whatever today 's outcome .
carl pistorius told itv news : i ca n't relate to the oscar that 's been portrayed by the prosecution .
oscar growing up , up until now , is the same person .
he 's bold , he 's brave , he 's got courage , he 's got charisma , he 's exciting and fun , thoughtful and intelligent , and has been the perfect fit as a middle child between us three siblings .
and he added that , whatever the judge 's decision today : the three of us [ himself , oscar and aimee ] will stand together and continue to stand together .

aimee pistorius said the family had never doubted the athlete 's version of the events of 14 february 2013 : when i first heard what had happened , obviously my initial reaction was just shock and devastation and extreme heartache .
my first thoughts were that knowing my brother the kind of person he is , as well as his fears he must have thought it was an intruder , before i knew the facts .
on the relationship between her brother and steenkamp , aimee pistorius said : i saw two people who really just adored each other , who had a fantastic friendship .
in a separate interview with enca news , aimee pistorius said steenkamp had been a very special person ¦ her family and her friends have lost so much .
aimee pistorius says she has no doubts that her brother thought reeva steenkamp was an intruder when he shot her .
oscar pistorius has arrived in the court room : ewn reporter ( @ ewnreporter ) # oscarpistorius arrives surrounded by police officers .
gn

documents.title: the case for and against prison
text: the defence case pistorius 's legal team say he should not be sent to prison because he is also a victim of what happened on 14 february 2013 : there was an accused and a victim ¦ and the accused became a victim .
we have a man who negligently , in an anxious and vulnerable state of mind , killed the woman that he loved .

negative media coverage and lurid speculation on social media which judge masipa said she would not take into account as well as the prosecution 's treatment of pistorius in court , had left him a broken man : he was denigrated ¦ a cold-blooded killer .
he has lost everything .
he does n't even have money to pay legal expenses .
he has nothing left .
lead counsel barry roux said the judge should apply the principle of ubuntu , humane punishment , in allowing pistorius to make good by doing something for society .
the money he paid to the parents of reeva steenkamp shows he wants to take responsibility .
a community service can be appropriate in cases such as this : is this a person you must remove from society ?
¦ we say no .
pistorius 's true sentence has been the loss of the woman he loved : it 's deep and it 's permanent and it wo n't go away ¦ no punishment can be worse than the last 18 months .
sending pistorius to prison , where he might not get proper medical care , could increase his risk of suicide and compromise the care he needs for his disabilities .
pistorius absolutely accepts the verdict of culpable homicide but his negligence in killing reeva steenkamp was born out of a genuine , if erroneous , belief that his life was at risk .
oscar pistorius has lost everything , says defence .
the state case lead prosecutor gerrie nel said pistorius must go to prison for at least 10 years : the only , but only , reasonable sentence would be a long-term incarceration .

in argument that veered close to implying judge masipa had made the wrong judgment in clearing pistorius of murder , nel said any sentence should acknowledge that the degree of negligence involved made the offence very close to murder .
a community sentence would be shockingly disproportionate to the crime : society trusts the court to deal with criminals ¦ to be harsh if it has to .
pistorius has shamelessly used his disability as an excuse andwants the court to think of him , not steenkamp , as the victim in this case .
the state does not believe he has shown remorse : the fact that he 's sorry she 's dead is not remorse for what he did ¦ it is not good enough .
the court has had months of hearing and thinking about oscar pistorius .
it now needs to think about reeva steenkamp and her family : what could be worse than hearing your child died a violent death ?
i 've thought about it : nothing .
the deceased did nothing to contribute to her death .
she did nothing .
she died a horrific death ¦ she had nowhere to go .
the state believes pistorius 's offer of a financial settlement to steenkamp 's parents was an attempt to influence sentence .
it is not the business of the court to worry about conditions in prison : pistorius can be catered for .
ten years ' imprisonment should be the minimum , says prosecution .

documents.title: morning round-up
text: welcome to live coverage of the sentencing hearing of oscar pistorius , in which we expect the judge , thokozile masipa , to hand down sentence this morning .

pistorius was last month cleared of the murder of reeva steenkamp but found guilty of culpable homicide , after he fired four bullets through the door of a toilet cubicle at his home , killing his girlfriend .
he maintained he had mistaken her for an intruder .
judge thokozile masipa .

skuy/pool/epa last week , five days of arguments in aggravation and mitigation of sentence saw the state call for a minimum prison term of 10 years for the athlete , saying his actions had been grossly unreasonable , while the defence team sought to persuade the judge that a period of house arrest and community service was the right punishment for a broken man who it says has lost everything .

in south africa there is neither a minimum nor a maximum prison sentence for culpable homicide , but in practice 10 years tends to be the upper limit : music star molemo jub jub maarohanye has recently received a 10-year sentence after being found guilty of culpable homicide for killing four children while drag racing .
but the defence specifically rejected comparisons with that case , denying that pistorius had acted consciously unlawfully on the night of 14 february 2013 .
masipa will reveal today in the high court in pretoria whether to meet the demand for a prison sentence , opt for community service , or seek a middle ground .
either side could then appeal and prolong the case yet further .
the guardian 's david smith will be in the courtroom in pretoria and you can read his tweets @ twitterid .
i 'll also be tweeting breaking news and key developments @ twitterid phipps .
david 's report on friday 's court hearing is here , and the live blog from the final day of sentencing arguments is here .
and here i 've put together a summary of all 48 days of the trial so far .
today 's court hearing is due to start at 9.30am south africa time ( 8.30am bst ) .

9.34am BST
09:34
Five years in jail for culpable homicide

bulletin.text: Live coverage as Judge Thokozile Masipa rules Pistorius should be jailed for the culpable homicide of Reeva Steenkamp, but could be released on house arrest after 10 months.
Oscar Pistorius trial: the full story, day by day.
